instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Hi, got this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no backlight, only when open a little bit i can see the display.

so I found here in the Rossmann Wiki this

[MEDIA=youtube]neigIMBUQf0[/MEDIA]

by the way the black film it can be more clean and easy removed with fine sandpaper instead of scratching with the knife

I tryed that and I have Display now but it looks like every second LED on the bottom is only working
Did somebody had that before?

is the problem here the display or a better guess a bad soldering?

It tryed already 2 times with 2 new cables but always the same result

need some help please

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Maybe bad solders, or some trace broken on the flex.
Did you test with known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Problem solved, there was another crack in the cable, so i connected like in youtube and some jumper wires then from the junction until almost where the cable is coming out of the screen, hell that was a solder trip! :-) ok, but its working now, thanks for help.
